Posts.Content: canadian28 wrote: Hi, I was just wondering if someone could please give me some advice regarding the ultrasound guided biopsy. So far Ive been very disappointed in the experience with the doctors I've delt with....I should mention I'm in Canada so it seems that the process might be a bit different then the US.  Anyways, Im now finally booked for a biopsy but no one seems to be able to tell me what to expect.  Today I called and they told me that I should be able to go back to work right after but from what Ive read on here that doesn't seem to be the case for everyone.  Am I just being silly taking the day off?  Also should I be driving if I'm going to be frozen? Im an absolute wreck over this.   Thank you so much for your help! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2010 04:57PM canadian28 wrote: Thank you everyone for all the advice. The heads up about the loud noise is especially helpful...I don't deal well with unexpected loud sounds:)  I don't think I'll be having a mamogram after...haven't had one yet but I'm 28 and they mentioned I was too young for that.  I will bring the sports bra though.  Hopefully it will be over and done with soon so I can stop thinking about it. So far it's been a very long process, but Im sure it's nothing and I'm just worrying for nothing.
